alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 12:30PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Albany and northwestern Laramie Counties through 115 PM MDT... At 1229 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Iron Mountain to 8 miles north of Whitaker. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Horse Creek and Iron Mountain. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 31 and 43. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
